User authentication is crucial because purchases require customer information and history tracking. So, I'll include registration, login, and logout functionalities. Next, the product catalog needs to be dynamic. Using a database makes sense here. I'll set up tables for products with details like name, description, price, and quantity. This allows easy management of available items. A shopping cart is another important component. It should allow users to add and remove items, adjust quantities, and calculate the total dynamically. Implementing this with PHP sessions will keep track of each user's selections without needing a database for the cart itself. For payment processing, integrating a secure method is necessary. PayPal API seems like a good choice because it's widely used and provides security features. I'll guide on setting up an account and using their SDK to handle transactions. Order management involves saving order details in the database once a purchase is made. This includes storing customer information and order items for future reference. After processing, redirecting the user with confirmation or back to the cart if there's an issue ensures smooth navigation. Database setup is fundamental. I'll outline creating tables for users, products, and orders with necessary fields like id, username, password hash, etc., ensuring security by hashing passwords. The checkout page needs to collect shipping info and display payment options. Using a form with user inputs and displaying cart items will make it clear for the customer. Security is key here, so I'll mention using HTTPS and sanitizing input data to prevent attacks. Testing each part step by step is important. From adding products to the cart, checking out, and ensuring that orders are correctly recorded. Also, verifying that sessions work as intended when users log in or logout. Finally, mentioning additional security measures like CSRF protection and input validation will help secure the application beyond basic implementation. Suggesting further enhancements like different payment gateways or order tracking can provide a roadmap for future improvements. Putting it all together, the solution covers the essential steps from setup to testing, ensuring a functional and secure purchase system.
